title: UFC heavyweight Walt Harris asks for public's help finding missing 19-year-old daughter
text:
UFC heavyweight Walt Harris is caught up in a scenario that is a father’s worst nightmare.

Friday, Harris took to social media to ask the public for help finding his 19-year-old daughter Aniah, who went missing Wednesday. In a tweet, Harris posted the number of Auburn, Ala. police and the make and model of her car.

🚨🚨🚨🚨🚨Please help!!!! Any info message me on here or call the Auburn police (334) 501-3140 Please!!! BOLO: Black 2017 Honda CRV Tag: 49BS356 My daughters name is Aniah! 🚨🚨🚨🚨🚨 https://t.co/cijO736cFH — Walt Harris (@thebigticket205) October 24, 2019

According to a report from local news station WTVM out of Georgia, Auburn, Ala. police say there is no foul play suspected. Aniah (who’s full name is Aniah Haley Blanchard) went missing Oct. 23 shortly before midnight.

The report also states:

“Blanchard is described as light in complexion, 5’6”, 125 pounds, with brown eyes and brown hair. She was last seen wearing a black dress, tan duck boots, and black stockings. Blanchard drives a black 2017 Honda CR-V with Alabama tag# 49BS356. The whereabouts of her vehicle are not known. Anyone with information on Blanchard’s whereabouts is asked to call the Auburn Police Division Detective Section at 334-501-3140, the anonymous tip line at 334-246-1391, or the 24-hour non-emergency number at 334-501-3100.”

In a post on Instagram, Harris shared photos of his daughter, including a shot of the two of them together:
description: Thursday, Walt Harris took to social media to ask the public for help finding his 19-year-old daughter Aniah, who went missing Wednesday.
